page.title: 16TOURISM IN BISHOPS FROME
page.content: There are hardly any signs of real tourists here. this is working, not rambling, countryside, and in spite of breathtaking views to the Welsh hills 25 miles away, no fields are turned over the caravans or campers, and 1 inn has accommodation. Footpaths are hardly marked and often impassable, and one cannot walk on the river banks. Two features attract visitors: Bishops Frome is known 40 miles away for its pub with real ale, and the church in Bishops Frome has a crusader tomb and family tombstones going back to 17th century - the visitors book in the past year has signatures from Spain, Canada, New Zealand, Hong Kong, USA and Malawi.
